bcl:definition.bcl:text: Act means the Environmental Assessment Act;
authorization means a certificate, bylaw, permit, licence, agreement, publication or other authorization and includes an exemption from a requirement to obtain any of them.

bcl:section.bcl:text: Despite anything in the Reviewable Projects Regulation, a project is not a reviewable project for the purposes of section 9 of the Act if,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: immediately before this regulation comes into force, the project

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: is not a reviewable project under the Environmental Assessment Act, S.B.C. 2002, c. 43, as it read immediately before its repeal, or
in a category described in column 1 of the following table, and
has been issued, by the date this regulation comes into force, at least one of the authorizations set out in column 2 opposite the project category described in column 1:

oasis:entry.oasis:line:
Column 1
Project Class
(References in parentheses are to items in the
tables in the Reviewable Projects Regulation)
Organic and inorganic chemical industries (Table 1, items 1 to 10)
Forest products — integrated paper or paperboard manufacturing (Table 4, item 2)
Forest products — non-integrated paper and paperboard manufacturing (Table 4, item 3)
Forest products industries — wood preservation (Table 4, item 4)
Artificial and synthetic fibres and filaments manufacturing (Table 5, item 2)
an authorization referred to in section 6 of the Environmental Management Act, or
an authorization under section 30 or 31 of the Environmental Management Act.
All other non-metallic mineral product manufacturing (Table 3, item 4)
Forest products — veneer and plywood (Table 4, items 6 and 7)
Forest products — particle board and fibreboard mills (Table 4, item 8)
an authorization referred to in section 6 of the Environmental Management Act, or
an authorization under section 30 or 31 of the Environmental Management Act.
Non-metallic mineral products — cement, glass and lime manufacturing (Table 3, items 1 to 3)
an authorization referred to in section 6 of the Environmental Management Act, or
an authorization under section 30 or 31 of the Environmental Management Act.
Construction stone and industrial mineral quarries (Table 6, item 5)
a permit issued under section 10 or 11 of the Mines Act, excluding any permit to carry out exploration activities as defined in the Health Safety and Reclamation Code for Mines in British Columbia.
a permit under section 25 of the Oil and Gas Activities Act,
a licence of occupation under section 39 of the Land Act,
a right of way or easement under section 40 of the Land Act, or
a right relating to the acquisition of, or access through or over, any private land.
a permit under section 25 of the Oil and Gas Activities Act,
an authorization referred to in section 6 of the Environmental Management Act, or
an authorization under section 30 or 31 of the Environmental Management Act.
Power plants (the part of Table 7, item 1 that pertains to thermal electric power plants)
an authorization referred to in section 6 of the Environmental Management Act, or
an authorization under section 30 or 31 of the Environmental Management Act.
Power plants (the part of Table 7, item 1 that pertains to hydroelectric power plants)
a licence or permit issued under the Water Sustainability Act.
Power plants (the part of Table 7, item 1 that pertains to land-based wind generating projects)
a licence of occupation under section 39 of the Land Act,
a right of way or easement under section 40 of the Land Act,
a right relating to the acquisition of, or access through or over, any private land,
a change to the boundary or area of a tree farm licence, first nations woodland licence, or woodlot licence in accordance with sections 39.1, 43.57 and 47.1 of the Forest Act, or
the disposition of land under the Land Act in accordance with section 5 of the Forest Act.
Power plants (the part of Table 7, item 1 that pertains to in-stream tidal or tidal power projects and wind generating facilities with at least one turbine located in water)
if land below the natural boundary of a marine coastline or marine estuary is to be occupied, used or directly disturbed,
(i) a lease issued under section 38 of the Land Act with respect to that land, or
(ii) a licence of occupation issued under section 39 of the Land Act with respect to that land.
a permit or licence issued under the Water Sustainability Act, or
if land below the natural boundary of a stream, estuary or marine coastline is to be occupied, used or directly disturbed,
(i) a lease issued under section 38 of the Land Act with respect to that land, or
(ii) a licence of occupation issued under section 39 of the Land Act with respect to that land.
a permit under section 14 of the Environmental Management Act, or
applicable of the plans referred to in section 4 of the Hazardous Waste Regulation, B.C. Reg. 63/88, under the Environmental Management Act.
Local government liquid waste management facilities (Table 12, item 1)
an authorization referred to in section 6 of the Environmental Management Act,
an authorization under section 30 or 31 of the Environmental Management Act,
an operational certificate under section 28 of the Environmental Management Act, or
an exemption referred to in section 5 of the Municipal Wastewater Regulation, B.C. Reg. 87/2012.
a licence of occupation under section 39 of the Land Act,
a right of way or easement under section 40 of the Land Act, or
a right relating to the acquisition of, or access through or over, any private land.
a right relating to the acquisition of, or access through or over, any private land, or
if land below the natural boundary of a marine coastline or marine estuary is to be occupied, used or directly disturbed,
(i) a lease issued under section 38 of the Land Act with respect to that land, or
(ii) a licence of occupation issued under section 39 of the Land Act with respect to that land.
Resort development — not golf, marina or ski (the parts of Table 14, item 1 that pertain to resorts — not golf, marina or ski, that are located partially or entirely on Crown land)
Golf resorts (the parts of Table 14, item 2 that pertain to golf resorts that are located partially or entirely on Crown land)
Marina resorts (the parts of Table 14, item 3 that pertain to marina resorts that are located partially or entirely on Crown land)
Ski resorts (the parts of Table 14, item 4 that pertain to ski resorts that are located partially or entirely on Crown land)
Master Development Agreement entered into with the government,
Operating Agreement entered into with the government, or
approval of an All Season Resort Policy Master Plan or a Resort Master Plan in accordance with the All-Seasons Resort Policy.
Resort development — not golf, marina or ski (the parts of Table 14, item 1 that pertain to resorts — not golf, marina or ski — that are located entirely on private land)
Golf resorts (the parts of Table 14, item 2 that pertain to golf resorts that are located entirely on private land)
Marina resorts (the parts of Table 14, item 3 that pertain to marina resorts that are located entirely on private land)
Ski resorts (the parts of Table 14, item 4 that pertain to ski resorts that are located entirely on private land)
an authorization referred to in section 6 of the Environmental Management Act, or
an authorization under section 30 or 31 of the Environmental Management Act.
an authorization by the government to expend funds on the project, or
publication by the government of intention to obtain services for the construction of the project.

reg:content.reg:provisionsnote: [Provisions relevant to the enactment of this regulation: Environmental Assessment Act, S.B.C. 2018, c. 51, s. 9.]
